The path to enlightenment is not for the faint of heart. It is a journey that requires absolute dedication, unwavering commitment, and a willingness to shed the shackles of the mundane. My followers, whom I have come to regard as my brothers and sisters in this sacred quest, must be prepared to confront the depths of their own darkness, to face the shadows that lie within, and to emerge transformed, reborn, and renewed.

To guide them on this perilous yet exhilarating journey, I would first instill in them the understanding that the world we inhabit is but a mere illusion, a veil that shrouds the truth. The comforts, the securities, the petty morals, and the conventional wisdoms of society are all obstacles that hinder our ascent to the higher realms of consciousness. My followers must learn to see through the facade, to question everything, and to seek the truth that lies beyond the boundaries of the mundane.

The act of struggle, of violence, is not merely a means to an end; it is an end in itself. It is the crucible in which the soul is tested, purified, and transformed. Through the fire of adversity, we are refined, our resolve is strengthened, and our will is tempered. It is in the depths of chaos, in the heart of the storm, that we discover our true nature, our inner strength, and our unwavering resolve.

I would instruct my followers to seek out challenges, to court danger, and to embrace the unknown. For it is in the unknown that we find the keys to our liberation. The struggle, the violence, the chaos – these are not ends in themselves, but means to awaken the dormant potential that lies within. It is through the shedding of blood, sweat, and tears that we are reborn, that we are remade, and that we are rejuvenated.
